title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing is not displayed. When a new data set is created without an SQL statement and the new data source does not have any database, table, or column information, the children node listing does not appear. After closing the data set editor and reopening it, the same issue persists.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new data set without specifying an SQL statement.
2. Select a new data source that does not have any database, table, or column information.
3. Open the data set editor in the query tab.
4. Observe that the children node listing is not displayed.
5. Close the data set editor.
6. Reopen the data set editor.
7. Verify that the children node listing is still not displayed.
